headline: The Real Mojito
description: Considered Cuba's national drink, this mojito cocktail is a favorite with pirates, swashbucklers, and colorful characters in the Caribbean and beyond.

video.description: The cocktail recipe in this video is an authentic mojito recipe. It's sized for one serving, but you can adjust it accordingly and make a pitcher full. It's a very refreshing drink for hot summer days. Be careful when drinking it, however.
video.name: The Real Mojito Recipe

name: The Real Mojito
recipeIngredient: 0.5 medium lime, cut into 3 wedges, divided
2 tablespoons white sugar, or to taste
1 cup ice cubes, or as needed
0.5 cup club soda, or as needed

recipeInstructions.text: Place mint leaves and 1 lime wedge into a sturdy glass. Use a muddler and crush to release mint oils and lime juice.
Add remaining lime wedges and 2 tablespoons sugar, and muddle again to release the lime juice. Do not strain the mixture.
Fill the glass almost to the top with ice. Pour in rum and fill the glass with club soda.
Stir, taste, and add more sugar if desired.

review.reviewBody: This is an amazing cocktail!
I used simple syrup. Used half the lime. Quite good.

This is my very favorite mojito recipe! It makes me think of summer and I LOVE summer! I've earned to grow my own mint(super easy) because this recipe calls for a lot of mint-- the fresher , the better. I wouldn't change a thing about this recipe.
Delicious recipe‚Ä¶entire family absolutely loved them. Very easy to make. We used a wooden spoon as a muddler and it worked just fine.
I added more rum. My mint was picked fresh from my own plant . Added more mint. Used organic tonic water.
So yummy! Love this recipe! Perfect!
Only change we made was to use 1 tsp of Splenda rather than 2 Tbsp sugar. Delish!!
Made as stated, Its a good start but I found it to be too sweet So second time, I didn‚Äôt use any sugar I used sprite and it was wonderful.

I cut my lemons into four squeezable wedges, and squeezed two in per drink. I also prefer adding the; lime, the syrup and the (not two tbsp, but 1 1/2 depending on preference mint leaves first, Club soda, mix in shaker, Than poured over ice Other than that a refreshing recipe üëç
Would add simple sugar to the two tbs white sugar as I think it could be sweeter

Tasty. Stuck close to recipe. No ice so I froze about 3 oz of club soda, still added more club soda. My twist was adding a few leaves of cilantro in addition to mint from my garden. Will definitely make this again.
Made this recipe for my wife who is a mojito snob and she was very happy with the taste. Good mint and lime flavor with the right amount of sweetness. This is a winner in our house.
Very good. I added blackberries for a nice little twist mmmmm
Very tasty and easy to make. Refreshing summer drink.
Made it just as the recipe directed and it was delicious!
Yummm!
I put two ounces of rum.
Good, but too sugary for me. Will use only 1tbsp next time.
I changed the sugar to Stevia. I Used 1 pack. Same great taste, not too sweet.
GOOD! Simple! Tasty!!
This was my first time making a mohito and I made it like the recipe and it was good!
I added about a teaspoon of simple syrup! This is absolutely delicious
Visit for more delicious recipes: https://youtu.be/_Pdiv5NzSxI
Simple and wonderful. This is my favorite version of my favorite drink. This recipe is a definite keeper!
This is a professional recipe that outperforms the great majority of Mojitos you‚Äôll taste at establishments. Follow the recipe to a T. Great recipe to have in your repertoire.

I made this recipe with simple syrup and with raw sugar granules and I actually loved the raw sugar taste better than simple syrup. Great recipe as is! Also recommend muddling some fresh berries or mango before adding the ice and club soda for variety!
Simply superb

I usually don't like mojitos but made this for a party because I had so much mint in the garden. It was delicious. I made simple syrup and used 2 TBSP instead of sugar, and the balance with the lime was excellent.
Just like I remembered. Thanks
First time I have made Mojitos. Friends loved it. Made recipe as is...thank you Brandy!

I made these twice. The first time I poured the sugar straight in, but it pooled and barely dissolved no matter how slow i went or how much I stirred. Second time I added an extra step and made simple syrup which went a really long way and really made them perfect!
Great recipe. It tastes awesome.
I love this recipe! Started making it and never look anywhere else.
wonderful and simple recipe
Absolutely perfect. I only had tonic water at hand but it was still pretty delicious.
Sooooo good! Great recipe!
Fresh tasting, crisp, delish

This drink is very yummy. I love peppermint, so I was drawn to try this drink, and I‚Äôm glad I did. I used 1oz rum because I don‚Äôt really like the taste of alcohol too much, since it‚Äôs a new taste for me. But after guzzling one drink and making another, well...we‚Äôll see how I react, lol. It‚Äôs just so good! It‚Äôs sweet, but I like sweet. I also used a lemon for my 2nd drink due to no more lime, and it tastes good that way too. Also, I‚Äôve learned to stir the mixture before adding ice, just so the sugar dissolves a little more. But there‚Äôs so much sugar that not all of it dissolving is okay.

I (accidentally) halved the sugar portion but thought the proportions on this recipe are perfect - it doesn't taste too much like rum, isn't overly sweet and has the perfect, balanced fragrance of mint and lime. Terrific.
Very, very yummy. For me I switched out the sugar for trivia and cut amount in half, but my husband followed it exactly. Both were crazy good, his was a little sweeter. Our go to recipe!

I made this drink exactly as the instructions stated and WOW!! I am not a big drinker, like a few times a year, so usually I find most alcoholic drinks tasting too strong for me. This however, was so delicious and hardly tasting like there was any alcohol in it. I can see how one could end up drinking the whole pitcher themselves!

This was very easy to make and it was so delicious. iuseCaptain Morgan‚Äôs White SPICED rum... I love this rum. It was the best Mojito I‚Äôve ever had..Even better than in Ball and Chain in Little Havana, Miami.. And I love their Mojitos.
I made it with out ice cubes. Had to use vodka. Was good enough for my appreciation and taste. Used a quad shot glass.

After trying several other recipes, this is the keeper. If any adjustments are needed, it could be the amount of mint, which would vary according to taste. But this recipe gives good balance of tartness, alcohol and sweetness.
Really easy and tasty! I added a few thin slices of serrano peppers to the muddle for an extra kick. Even better!
Its an absolutely refreshing and delicious I make it all the time. Its better when I make it a glass at a t ime..
Yummy!

I made this with a teaspoon of simple syrup instead of sugar. This recipe turned out great. I also used home grown mint, fresh limes, perrier and expensive rum. Im not sure how all of those things add up to a delicious mojito, but it did.
Nice.
Excellent!!

This is by far my favorite Mojito. If you don‚Äôt have Bacardi, you can substitute with vodka and it‚Äôs also really good. Sometimes I use simple syrup instead of the sugar and it‚Äôs very sweet and addicting. Watch out! I want more and more
Oh my da

This is my favorite mojito recipe :) the guys at Montana spirits and wine told me mojito is with vodka and looked at me strangely when I told them that‚Äôs not the recipe I am following but other people seem to say they like it better with this recipe. I went a little adventurous and rather than sugar I do stevia and I got an AHA lime+ watermelon seltzer rather than club soda. So good mom doesn‚Äôt drink and she said it was good. Little known fact you can substitute club soda for any seltzer so to make it really boozy one can simply add a Truly hard seltzer or a Bud Lifht seltzer I myself like the kiwi mango truly hard seltzer‚Äôs with this mojito :) thanks so much for the recipe

This recipe is greatly enhanced by using Squirt (grapefruit) soda. We add less than a teaspoon of sugar as the soda is already sweetened. Flor de Cana is also my preferred rum but they are all fine. Mojitos rock!
Superb! Very refreshing summer drink. We found we needed almost 3 T. of sugar to get it to our taste.
This is a Great Summer drink made with fresh mint from the yard and Lakanto Golden Monkfruit Sweetner! Zero Calories Zero Carbs and Zero Sugar it's an Awesome Summer Refresher!
Perfect summer drink! I do use homemade simple syrup instead of just sugar as it mixes better.

This is a delicious and very authentic mojito! I am personally not a fan of sweet cocktails, though, so I made mine with only 1 teaspoon of sugar. It came out perfectly, to my taste - but I can see how someone with more of a sweet tooth might prefer more.

I also garnished mine with an extra sprig of mint. Love this, will be making it a lot this summer!
It was great as written.
Too much sugar
Very tasty and easy recipe. Thanks!
Very refreshing!!!! I used 3/4 sugar will try half next time.

I decided to make this for my hubby for Father's Day and he absolutely loved it. Like the other reviewers, I created a simple syrup first. IN the first batch, I put exactly 10 mint leaves per glass. In the 2nd batch, I upped the ante to 14 mint leaves per glass - and that is now my favorite version. Many thanks for this fantastic recipe!
Pretty good but it doesn't specify what size glass. It needs a tall tea glass or less sugar. I might try lime flavored soda water next time. Goid on a hot day!

Tried this recipe as is and just takes a little extra stirring to get the sugar to dissolve. Sugar can also be substituted with regular or liquid stevia to taste for a ‚Äúsugar free‚Äù choice. Liquid stevia goes a long way! New favorite summer time drink!

My go to recipe. Follow it very closely as the ratio is key. Use super fine/castor sugar - no need for simple syrup as it dissolves. I use this for all recipes that call for simple syrup - so much easier.

I followed the steps exactly and it turned out perfectly. If you make this and don‚Äôt like it, check your mint variety. Use a spearmint variety NOT a peppermint variety which has a higher level of menthol. HINT: don‚Äôt have too many limes on hand or you‚Äôll be tempted to make more and more and more!
I made enough for 4 servings; in a pitcher. Once I muddled the mint leaves, sugar and lime, I added to a pitcher. Added ice, then the 3\4 c Bacardi Light Rum and 1 liter of club soda. It was perfect!
Easy to make and delicious with our fresh mint. We had lime sparkling water and used that. It was great! Thanks for the recipe!
just slap the mint between your hands! more minty flavor that way
Make recipe with a whole lime (mine were small). Used only 1 tablespoon of sugar. This was so refreshing! I will make this again and again! Hello summer!
Great, easy recipe. Will be enjoying these through the summer.
Delicious mojito!

Great easy recipe for a very tasty result. I fooled around with different types of rums and sugars and my favorite was white rum with turbinado sugar (reduced to 1.5 tbsp). Also great with a splash of black currant syrup. Looking forward to more experiments when my raspberries and blackberries come in.

This recipe was tremendous. Bright and refreshing! It was perfect for a sunny afternoon. For one of the drinks I made, I used 2 packs of Splenda rather than sugar. I preferred it because I do not like things to be quite so sweet. (Although I believe that 3 packs of Splenda would be equivalent to 2 tablespoons of sugar in sweetening power.) Lastly, I used a flavored rum (mine was Gator Bite satsuma rum) which added an extra dimension. I‚Äôm looking forward to trying it with the other flavor rums though it would be really amazing with just regular plain white rum.
Super good. Drinking it right now. Added 1/2 teaspoon sugar extra bc I like it like thatttttttt babbbbyyyyy.
Great recipe. Decided to upsize to a pitcher, all disappeared in a flash!
Made a test glass exactly as shown in the recipe and it was delicious and refreshing! Super easy and fun to make! I‚Äôm making a pitcher tomorrow. Salud!
Wow, this is an excellent recipe. Loved it!
perfect
I made this but used tito's vodka and 3 tbs of sugar. So good!
This was great for my first time. I think though the next time I will make a simple syrup as others have recommended. Otherwise it was fantastic!
Easy and refreshing. It‚Äôs a perfect summertime drink.
More rum Malibu Passion fruit.
Easy & Delicious!! Don‚Äôt forget to smack that mint before you drop it in the glass...helps to release that lovely mint aroma!!

This is one of the better mojitos we've had. Maybe not the absolute best (nothing a little tinkering won't fix), but for a DIY mojito, it definitely gets the job nicely done! The husman (too old for "boyfriend," but not married) and I are doing a weekly "cocktail night" and this was the featured cocktail we experimented with for Cocktail Night #2. Solid recipe for this drink. I've had way worse at actual restaurants. 
oh, we used: Puerto Angel white rum, 12 mint leaves per drink, and muddled the heck out of the first 3 ingredients! 

Cheers!
So lovely. I've made this for three quarantine cocktail hours in a row. Great drink to cut the heat of a spicy meal. Last night it accompanied Korean Fried Chicken and was absolutely perfect.
I used sprit instead of soda water and sugar, works great.
This was great! I used mint from my garden. 3 tb of sugar was better for me!
I used simple syrup that I made instead of sugar. I used 1.5 TBS and it was sweet enough!
Holy this is good! I‚Äôve made many mojitos in my life but this was the best and easiest. Thank you for sharing.

This recipe taste really good and refreshing. The only thing I changed was, instead of using white rum. I used flavored rum, I used coconut bacardi because the liquor store I go to didn't have white rum. Taste really really good, I def will be making this drink recipe again. Thanks for sharing.
Very good.... needs a bit more sugar
I had fresh picked blueberries so, added 1/4 cup blueberries and squeezed half of the lime juice and muddled with the mint leaves. Then added rum and sugar. Too with club soda Delicious!
Added a scant pinch of salt to balance sweetness!
Delicious but wayyyyy too sweet! I used 1 tbsp sugar and could have used less.
Sprite instead of soda. Great recipe
Perfect
Best mojito I‚Äôve made and tasted in a while! Thank you for sharing
